newsitem.title: USA: NYC bar to hold "pay-to-play" symposium June 11.
newsitem.headline: NYC bar to hold "pay-to-play" symposium June 11.

text.p: New York City's bar association will hold a symposium on its controversial rule to curb "pay-to-play" by municipal bond lawyers at its New York City headquarters on June 11, a spokesman told Reuters.
Scheduled to chair the session is Robert Abrams, former New York State attorney general, the spokesman for the Association of the Bar of the City of New York added.

Among scheduled panelists are Julianna Ebert, president of the National Association of Bond Lawyers, and Paul Maco, director of the Securities and Exchange Commission's office of municipal securities.
Additional details about the session were unavailable.

Pay-to-play refers to bond professionals that give contributions to elected municipal officials in return for bond business. The Securities and Exchange Commission has launched a campaign to get bond lawyers to adopt voluntary curbs against the practice.
